name: Hotel Metropole Bellagio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eight lovely days - a wonderful location for ferry visits to surrounding towns. Boat tour to Villa Balbianello, cooking class with Chef Moreno, daytrip to Lugano, Switzerland, Saturday shopping in Como, visits to Villa Carlotta and Villa Melzi and lunch at Isola Comacina made this a fabulous vacation. Go while your knees are still in good shape, aside from the water-facing promenade where Hotel Metropole is located, everything was uphill. Waterfront room was fine as were our meals in the dining room. Friendly staff was eager to please.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently, friends preparing for their first trip to the Lake Como area asked for a hotel suggestion in Bellagio. Since we have stayed twice at the Hotel Metropole most recently in June of 2011 for a week, the Metropole was at the top of our list. On both stays we found the Hotel to be clean, convenient with a very courteous staff. We are planning to return ourselves in 2013.
reviews.title: Strong Recommendation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: By far the Metropole is the best value of any direct waterfront hotel in Bellagio. We would suggest a corner room for a bit more space and a direct view of the lake. Breakfast is included in the price and we found the view from the dining room spectacular, the buffet style offerings were of very good quality. The location is unparalleled, as you can essentially walk out the front door and be at the dock or a local restaurant in minutes. The staff at the front desk is among the best that we have encountered on our many trips to Italy. They are friendly, professional and helpful. They will always steer you in the right direction, figuratively and literally and will offer great suggestions in planning your itinerary. Within minutes they had us mapped out for boat and bus ride to Lugano Switzerland without problem.
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to enjoy the roof top terrace that is open for guests. It offers a great respite for travelers and very relaxing spot after a long day cruising the lake. Purchase a bottle of wine and cheese from a local alimentari and sit an watch the weather come across the lake and mountains. A remakable view from a great hotel.
reviews.title: Our second visit in 6 months

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the location of the hotel is just too good. we did not take the room with lake facing balcony, instead we took the room which had the side views but no regrets, the view was still enchanting. Just that when you open the balcony door to have some fresh air, you would smell petrol and diesel fumes which was very annoying at times.Breakfast was excellent, staff was helpful and nice.overall a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: The only choice in Bellagio and the best restaurant in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s pretty high up in the “best hotels in Bellagio” on Tripadvisor. There’s a good reason for it and I just hope that everyone won’t spoil what is a little gem.
reviews.title: Just hope that its popularity won't spoil it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enough has been said about Bellagio, but in short it’s a really pretty little town and the perfect spot to just relax. After some quite major cities and touring, to come here and relax was refreshing. The town has attractive, cobble-stoned streets with plenty of shops (particularly selling silk products) and quaint little trattorias, pasticcerias and gelaterias.
reviews.title: Stunning views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a corner room which gave us access to 2 balconies, 1 facing the lake and the other facing the promenade (and partially facing the lake). The room is a bit small but is clean, tastefully decorated and perfectly acceptable 3-star standard. The shower has good water pressure and the TV though small, is LCD with a lot of channels (Italian, English and some French and German channels). The bedding is comfortable and the air conditioning works nicely.
reviews.title: Magical !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lift is tiny but the stairways are quite wide so in order to work off some of the pasta and pizza, you can always walk up the stairs (unless you are checking-in/out with your luggage).
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel right on the lake!! Good value and great food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very accommodating and helpful and professional and are quite knowledgeable not only the hotel but the town and other towns on the lake.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel metropole was very good it was right on the front all the rooms have a good view but would recomend a balcony. It can be noisy in the morning which did not bother me as i was always up early just admiring the view and people watching would highly recomend.
reviews.title: belagio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here twice and you cannot beat the location and view. The hotel is clean, the staff pleasant and helpful. Excellent location to the ferry dock, especially if you are bringing heavy luggage-no need to climb the many staircases of Bellagio as the hotel is next to the dock. Restuarant was fine-I had a few good meals, but the view on the water is the best, especially at night. The roof deck is a treat as well.
reviews.title: "Best view"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After arriving on the ferry from Como , this hotel is just a short stroll from the terminal .
reviews.title: This lovely hotel has marvellous views of the Lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: On arrival you walk into the lovely warm decor of their reception , the staff are very efficient and friendly .
reviews.title: Second to None!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times , and I always book a corner room for two reasons
reviews.title: Superb Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. The bed very comfortable, and the sheets and linens were thick and clean. The breakfast nice, typical euro hotel breakfast (altho, it ended at 10am which is still kind of early for some vacationers like us). Hot water never ran out. Really polite, multi-lingual, friendly, helpful staff.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel. Super awesome roof deck for all guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd stay there again if I had to go back to Bellagio. (Which I probably won't because I found Bellagio and the other towns on the lake kind of boring.)
reviews.title: They get Everything Right!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I just returned from a 3 day trip to Lake Como where we had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Metropole in Bellagio. The location could not be better - the only hotel directly on the water in the quaint and beautiful town of Bellagio, steps (literally) from the ferries to go to other lake towns, and in the center of the village's restaurant and bar area. All of the rooms have at least a side lake view, but we had a terrace room which was amazing - 18 sq meter terrace with table, chairs, umbrella, and lounge chairs directly on Lake Como. It was also quiet despite its central location. The room was clean with towel warmers in bathroom and king bed. The only downside is the restaurant is somewhat average (although a nice breakfast is included with meats, cheeses, pastries, granola, etc) and the room - while clean - is nothing very special. Highly recommend Bellagio as a town when considering Lake Como, we like it much more than the more expensive and touristy Como itself, and will certainly return to the Metropole.
reviews.title: Terrific lake-front hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its all about location. The hotel is right on the lakeside and a stones throw from either of the ferry terminals. I booked a room with a balcony and front lake view as read previous reviews and wasn't disappointed - worth the extra money. Nice room and fluffy towels ! Breakfast is typical of most continental selections -pan au chocolats yummy.
reviews.title: Just Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I appreciate others may have had a great time at this hotel but my personal experience was very poor.
reviews.title: Avoid this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the restaurant at the Hotel Metropole and were served a square slab of pizza as if it had come from a budget frozen food store.. The pizza was cold with some ham & tomato thrown on top. When we complained about this the staff were unwilling to help. Eventually they reheated the pizza to within an inch of its life. When we refused to pay for this poor quality food the best they could offer was a threat to call the police and abuse of my wife and I.
reviews.title: It's all about the location

likes.disliked: — Lack of airconditioning in our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice - Avoid this hotel at all costs. There are far better places on Lake Como with "Real" Italian food served by staff who appreciate their customers.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great hotel
Good choice for Bellagio
reviews.text: Great location in town. Staff gave helpful guidance for parking, which is challenging. We selected room with a balcony which gave a great view and if it hadn't been raining would have been a fantastic place to enjoy the lake. Needed to leave the window open when it was warm out as A/C wasn't available yet. This meant times of diesel fumes from the ferry boats. We managed ok, but without a breeze, this could have been "bad". Room also had some kind of odor, either strong cleaning fluids or leftover smell from renovation work. Breakfast had lots of choices with a really good espresso machine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked a 7 night stay at the Metropole for myself and my husband and my parents.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wish I could understand the hype about this place from the other reviewers.... it was one of the worst hotels we've ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Awful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room decor is garage sale, carpets frayed, 1949 TV set, glaring fluorescent lights in bathroom, rubber pillows and prison-cell hard "beds". Breakfast buffet very limited, and picked over (and not replenished) an hour before breakfast was over. Tried to have dinner, but a tour bus of maybe 75 people showed up with us, and we took a pass.
reviews.title: Great spot for getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff indifferent at best, and nobody to help you with your luggage.
reviews.title: Bellagio- heaven!

likes.disliked: — The run-down furniture and bathroom design - water goes everywhere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Yes, the location is good and the rooms have nice views. So do most of the other hotels in town.
reviews.title: Excellent service
Loved Bellagio and The Metropole
reviews.text: Take a pass-- there are many better places in Bellagio!

reviews.title: Hotel Metropole: Couldn't Have Chosen a Better Hotel
reviews.text: I do a lot of research prior to selecting a hotel. The Hotel Metropole is located directly on Lake Como. From my research, I believe it is the only hotel on the lake in Bellagio having rooms with terraces. I was lucky enough to be able to reserve a lakefront room at the Metropole with a large terrace. The location is perfect - just a short walk from the dock.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I call this hotel room "The Room with a View." It was spectacular (not the room - the view!). The room itself was spacious and clean, but simple in decor with "French" doors leading out to the terrace.
reviews.title: Fab place but the cuisine was disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bathroom was large and clean also with "French" doors leading out to the terrace.
reviews.title: Great lake views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: The hotel common areas were not particularly special. The front desk personnel was always courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Enjoyed stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was typical of what we usually are offered in Italy, plus a variety of coffee.
reviews.title: Front Desk Personnel Made Metropole Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Will we visit again? Oh yes - as we approached on the ferry from Varenna we felt like we were coming home.
reviews.title: Best views on the lake!
A room with a view
reviews.text: We had decided to spend the Easter weekend in Bellagio during our travels, based on the rave reviews from my parents who have been here twice before. While they had stayed at the Hotel Du Lac previously, Dad had mentioned that the Metropole looked like it might be the better choice. We decided to give it a go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the end it was the perfect choice. The hotel is just beautiful, the staff so wonderfully warm and friendly, the views spectacular, and the restaurant the best in Lake Como.
reviews.title: If there is a heaven, here it is !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected this hotel based on descriptions from other Trip Advisor guests. We booked late - and could only get two of the three nights we wanted. I think also, as a result, we ended up with one of the smallest rooms in the hotel. But it had a tiny balcony with two chairs, with a wonderful view of the lake.
reviews.title: Excellent value in delightful Bellagio

likes.liked: — Fantastic location in the center of Bellagio overlooking Lake Como

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: For only 11 euros per person over the regular room rate we had half-board included. Dinner offered a salad buffet, and then a 3 course meal. Usually a choice two pastas and a soup, 3 entree choices, and a selection of about 8 desserts. The Italians do love love their sweets! The food was good, not outstanding, but compared to the prices we encountered elsewhere in Italy was a fantastic bargain. The included buffet breakfast was quite nice.
reviews.title: On Bellagios Secret Service

likes.liked: — The huge sun terrace and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff, both at the front desk and in the restaurant were more than helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Room with a view
Super holiday - 2 West Yorkshire 'oldies'
reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in August and had a fabulous time.
reviews.title: Perfect

aka: Hotel Metropole Bellagio Italy - Lake Como
description: Recently restored, Hotel Metropole is situated in the center of the village and is the only one with restaurant and terrace directly on the lake. The rooms have a beautiful view, full or side, some with balcony or terrace; all have private facilities with bath or shower, air conditioning, electric fans, telephone, TV satellite, mini-bar, hairdryer. On the nice solarium you can admire the spectacular panorama of the Como lake.
